metadata.synopsis: Wulbren is holding counsel with his fellow gnomes (if they survived moonrise) when he is interrupted by the player. He is condescending a arrogant. We can discover a little about the ironhand gnomes.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Free from jail in Moonrise, then talk in Haven.

19.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
19.text: Hm? Oh - you made it. Well done.

24.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
24.text: Steering a boat is hardly a challenge - and this place is near a beacon in the darkness.
24.context: NodeContext: being a bit of a dickhead here

31.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
31.text: As if there was any doubt.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Yes, despite the fact that you left me behind.

4.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
4.text: It was that or we all die. We clearly didn't - so it was the right choice.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: I should gut you where you stand, traitor!

59.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
59.text: Look, were our positions reversed, I'd be angry too. But if I die, every Ironhand Gnome in the realm will suffer for it.
59.context: NodeContext: trying to calm the player down, in full maniuplation here. Being calm, acting like he had no choice

30.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
30.text: Besides, in the end, we both survived. And that's all that matters. So let's call this a fresh start, for us both.
30.context: NodeContext: reasonable and matter of fact, not allowing room for further argument

39.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
39.text: You're good to have humoured Barcus for so long. The poor fellow is like creeping moss, if you know what I mean.
39.context: NodeContext: Wulbren sees Barcus as a fly in his soup and is trying to bond with the player over it.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: I don't. Perhaps you could explain.

65.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
65.text: ...Never mind. Now, is there something you want? I'm a busy man.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: He's got more courage than you give him credit for.

7.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
7.text: I'm sure, but that's his business. Now, is there something you want? I'm a busy man.
7.context: NodeContext: Stifling a laugh at the mention of Barcus as 'courageous'

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I'm not here to talk about Barcus - I'm here to talk about you.

9.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
9.text: Is that so? Well, you've piqued my curiosity.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: You're not going to thank me for saving your life?

61.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
61.text: Did I not already? How remiss of me.

37.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
37.text: Here - that should cover your services.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I deserve payment - if not for me, you'd be dead.

95.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
95.text: Surely Barcus will take care of that.

70.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
70.text: You forget - it was I who planned every step of our escape.

89.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
89.text: But even brawn deserves recompense. Here - this should suffice.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: What will you do when you get out of here?

81.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
81.text: I have plans in Baldur's Gate - the work of many years labour that will finally bear fruit.

100.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
100.text: You should look for me once we're in city. The name 'Wulbren Bongle' will be mentioned among many, I've little doubt.

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *You recall stories of the Ironhand Gnomes - a talented group of inventors who were banished from Baldur's Gate.*

36.speaker: Player
36.text: You're quite confident in yourself, aren't you?

3.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
3.text: If you'd accomplished half of what the Ironhand Gnomes have, you would be too.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: We just have to get to the city first.

72.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
72.text: We will. The Ironhand Gnomes have survived worse.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Weren't the Ironhand Gnomes exiled from Baldur's Gate?

66.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
66.text: Do not speak of a story you only know the half of.

8.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
8.text: We are inventors of the highest order, matched, perhaps, but never surpassed by the Gondians at the High House of Wonders.

45.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
45.text: But our forebears were foolish - complicit with Sarevok's madness over a century past, and so we were banished. Still are to this day.

0.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
0.text: The very one. It's the only mistake the Ironhand Gnomes ever made - and it cost us everything.

87.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
87.text: I've fought tooth and nail to restore our reputation. Particularly against Gondian detractors who live in glass houses.

79.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
79.text: Our return to Baldur's Gate will usher in a new era for the Ironhand Gnomes. The realm deserves the benefit of our genius.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: Siding with a murderous lunatic is more than 'foolish'.

46.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
46.text: Perhaps. But why should I be punished for a mistake I took no part in? The Gondians refuse us, time and time again.

17.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
17.text: You agree with such machinations? Duly noted.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Runepowder - I know you were looking for it in the Underdark. What are you planning?

26.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
26.text: To use it as all innovators do - for the good of the realm. Nothing to concern yourself with.
26.context: NodeContext: slight smirk here at his own inside joke

49.speaker: Player
49.text: What part do you play in the Ironhand Gnomes?

77.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
77.text: I am more than a 'part'. I am its oil and gears; I am its purpose - its leader.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: How do you and Barcus know each other?

6.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
6.text: Oh, we hail from the same village in the Underdark. Hung about in the same passel of children.

5.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
5.text: Barcus tends to make more of it than it is.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I'll leave you to your own devices.

56.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
56.text: Every moment Ketheric lives is another I am away from Baldur's Gate - I need to return. And soon.
56.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.NodeContext: authorative

67.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
67.text: Whatever that light is - the Harpers and Flaming Fist can deal with it. We'll follow once it's safe.

80.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
80.text: Whatever that light is - the Harpers can deal with it. We'll follow once it's safe.

82.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
82.text: Excuse me. This prick is busy. Why don't you and Barcus go entertain each other elsewhere.
82.context: NodeContext: Player called him a prick earlier, so Wulbren is bristling

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I apologise for losing my temper, but you were being rather harsh.

48.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
48.text: Perhaps, but sometimes cruelty is a kindness. Believe me, Barcus would do well to keep his distance.

69.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
69.text: Now, is there something you want? I'm a busy man.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Once a prick, always a prick.

71.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
71.context: NodeContext: REsponding to 'once a prick, always a prick.' Very cutting, directed at the player.

83.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
83.text: Hm? Oh - I don't need anything else. Thanks.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Your friend Barcus is just around the corner - have you said hello?

63.speaker: Player
63.text: That's not a nice way to greet a friend.

27.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
27.text: Friend is a strong word, don't you think?

99.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
99.text: I'm a busy man - state your business.

86.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
86.context: NodeContext: Edgy. Annoyed at being distracted.

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Mind if I ask you a question or two?

93.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
93.text: Ketheric's lackeys found me already - blast it all. You need to deal with him.
93.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.NodeContext: authorative

102.speaker: Wulbren Bongle
102.text: The sooner someone deals with Moonrise, the quicker we can leave.
